comments.body:
I think this might be a good idea

 

1 more reason to have silverfish in ur deepdark house
I think this is an awesome idea! The silverfish are like the little mini wardens of the Ender Dragon after all haha
like humans with spiders, something absolutely smaller and weak then you that you can easily pulverise it and yet your terrrified of it
Please shared this idea
The Warden wouldn‚Äôt be completely horrible beyond description if they added this
Eyyy I thought this too, it's even in the name!
This is a very good idea, the problem is that, in that case, sculk sensors wouldn't detect creepers either (unless steping over them) so creepers will be even more dangerous
Chameleons can be your pet if you feed them jade plant
Tameable chameleons should give the user the ability to carry them on their shoulder to equip camouflage!
or maybe change it to like "thick potion" or a other useless potion
and if they add this i will just make a chest full of decay and have all the thieves take those

You can also add this, you take the item drop and cook it to make cooked frog legs. It is a cuisine in real life, so I thought it could be used in Minecraft too. It raises your food bar by three or two.
I need to light up my caves gosh darn it. At least make it an option for next year's mob vote.
I think the functionality of the glare should be an item. I don't think a mob whose entire purpose is to find dark spaces should be something that spawns in the game unless it's very rare.

Personally, the Glare's mechanic wasn't useful enough, now I'm a bit biased using Java, but also the fact that once 1.18 rolls out, dark is dark enough.

Now if Glare was a moving light source that growled when hostile mobs were near, that would be handy and a unique pet for exploring the underground. Imagine an early Creeper detector that followed you around, and help cut down on troches when mining (Win-Win). 

Or if the Glare would patrol along the edges of light (wouldn't go into darkness/Zero space) and growl when a hostile mob was near, you could set it up as a wandering guard dog and setting its path with light sources and it would randomly wiggle around. It could be watching your back in an open base or shaft moving around a little bit and sounding off when danger comes. 

A mob who purposely goes where it doesn't want to just to pout... is counterintuitive at best. And while acute Quality of Life helper for lighting. Being able to potential autosort with the Allay, or collect drops without filling your own inventory, is a good win. It was also the catch with the Copper Golem, you could easily use a pressure plate and chicken to make a random readstone signal. Now if the golem helped with farming/fishing/lumber it would of easily won.
I think it would be great if it was expanded on and we where told more about what it can do! Maybe they can start putting old mob vote mobs into different mob votes?? I think that would be great!
The Glare should be brought back later it can be a amazing mob found in the caves. I can imagine having one as a pet in Minecraft.
I think that allays already act like fairies or pixies - having the ability to bottle them and transport them would be wonderful.
The allay is a spirit and a Tome(Book) to hold it would fit in with its aesthetic

This is genius. Imagine you‚Äôre building something and break some scaffolding, you could pull out the allay it could fly down collect the scaffolding and give it to you in seconds. Then once‚Äôs it‚Äôs done you could easily collect it and put it back in your inventory.
This seems cool! While Fennecs are more well known, Grey Foxes don't get much attention, being one of the few canids able to climb trees.
The grey fox could just have the spider AI lol, so they randomly climb stuff
Please add a kraken as a miniboss in minecraft
I totally agree with you I love tigers üêØ

Yes, plants, fungi, and animals have unique needs, intelligence, and purposes. Unfortunately, they are not being treated seriously in Minecraft with an exception of villagers and bees and maybe piglins but I haven't been to the Nether yet.

I built a farmhouse for sheep and cows in survival and it was hard work. It had a good vibe but the animals didn't care they just jumped up and down with their face in a wall. But then again that could mean they like it but it's kinda hard to interpret so you'll never truly know unless mobs show more emotions.

A major part of minecraft are the mobs. What would survival be without them? But if we revamped their AI and the ecosystems (key word: systems) that the mobs make up, then minecraft is instantly a billion times better.

And since the major update titles have used poems, I think the title should actually be:

The Flora, the Fauna, and the Monsta

But your title describes the name of the game better
Maybe undead monsters could rise right out of the ground. Now THAT would be some atmosphere.

Since mincraft is about conserving real life animals (reasons for panda being introduced) and for spreading awareness (reasons for bees), it would be amazing if an ecological update was introduced. Plants and animals should have the ability to shape the environment like in real life. Wolves could build dens and rabbits could build borrows. Animals may graze and migrate around to get fresh grass to eat. It would teach players more about the real world and help them understand our environment.
feel free to take the ideas
yes. we should do this
Nice so basically this is the loosing biome vote update?
yes, really just with a couple of extras
yes absoultly that will be great also if they added peacocks, parkeets , woodpickers , eagles, vultures, taucans, and penguins
vultures were in my initial post, but otherwise  i really like ur ideas especially woodpeckers
fantastic idea!
Do you guys want to add in roadrunners? Also, maybe you should tell us more about some of these features.
Soooooooooooooooooooooooo Good
peaceful mode is really kinda boring for me, and when also i see something that has some connection with spiders i exit the game, i almost cry, and i get crazy thinking that there are spiders near me
you can do that with a datapack

Absolutely this.

To the suggestion of with a datapack: this can't be done reliably with that, and there isn't a well-maintained datapack to achieve this either.

It would perhaps be easier to replace the model and sounds with something less triggering.

can be located in their own mini biome far away and super duper rare, like the mooshrooms. I think they should have some rare drop or something. Not sure what though. Maybe breedable with glowberries after the new update.
ARK players:
Gostei da ideia
I'm voting but you need more info about the dodo that will separate it from the common chicken.
I think for this to work there should be a biome registered as an island.
If you threw dodo eggs, would they be able to hatch into baby dodos, like with the chicken?

Maybe to give them more of a purpose, instead of being more aggressive, they would be more protective, and they'd protect their sheep herd, attacking anything that tries to attack sheep around it, like a wolf or a player. This would make players eat more diverse foods too, or give them more of a challenge, that way players don't just farm wild sheep in abundance, they would go for cows and pigs too, or they would have more of a challenge to try and overcome, even if it was small.
probably faster at running but shoots more but has bad aim
Nice idea
yes add panther please that would be a great thing we have not got new animals in a hot minute.
DO IT JUST DO IT
They should look like creepers without the torso

You have to explain why you want this mob.
Right now I can't think of anything good about it
This is going to make a lot of builders mad...you made a creeper that is small...life has no meaning anymore...
But they can be much faster, in fact, 5 times!
Sounds cute üôÇ
they should be tameable

You should add baby creepers, that are slightly fast than the grown ones. But instead of blowing up they stick to you and slow you down, and the only way to get them off would to be applying wax or staying under water till your air runs out.

Baby creepers should be smaller creepers. They blow up a 3x3 block area with a few extra blocks beneath it. So it is a smaller explosion.

They have 3 health points (6 hearts). They are slow. It will move at the same speed as a nornal creeper, and they can walk on water.

They drop 0-1 gunpowder. Creepers will be updated to drop 1-3 gunpowder.
Love the idea, but I would call them by their other name, Trapdoor Spiders
Craznag, that is a very good idea! This name fits the game aesthetics nicely. Thank you for your suggestion!

I have another simple addition to my suggestion. With the second name of the spider being revealed - Trapdoor Spider - the animation for hiding can resemble closing and opening of a trapdoor. I guess, it could be hard to pull out with my idea of having a block being stuck to your shield, so I have a solution. Your shield (so is the behind of the spider) can just mimic the texture of a block you are on. And when you or the spider hide under or jumps out the ground, the sound of a closing\opening trapdoor could play.

It could be a fun addition to spice the gameplay up a bit - making you scared of trapdoor sounds. Imagine walking around your world and hearing the unexpected opening sound of a trapdoor in the middle of the woods or by your excavation site... Jesus...

And in addition to the mimicking - if you don't want the shield to be too OP, you can make that the unique texture of the shield would still be active with the camouflage mod on. But a loud sound of an opening\closing trapdoor is a hard nerf by itself, so for smart multiplayer players, the sound would be enough to know, that another player is near them.

It might be more balanced, if hiding would affect your oxygen levels. You should hold breath to be able to stay underground, plus adding a cool down for the ability to make it harder to spam it also would be handy.

I don't think this should be in minecraft, while I might be biased as I have my own deep dark lizard mob, I feel that this "ScalesMeat" is not only a silly name but not enough incentive to go to the deep dark and hunt these things. The only I might change my mind about this meat is if it restores that amount of hunger uncooked. Another thing is, why do I have to breed them underground? I know what you mean, as you want to keep them exclusive to the deep dark, but what's stopping us? What is stopping us from grabbing a few leads, heading to the deep dark, and snagging some Tippers to breed at my enormous base. The only thing I admire is your vote count for a mob you suggested yesterday but I do not believe this thing should be in minecraft.

This should be in the game because almost every lizard irl uses vibrations to hunt (and snakes too) and it could look like the axolotl and it being the predator of the warden seems like a big nope but minecraft could add it to add awareness to a endangered species of lizards good idea should be in the game
From what we have seen from the clips, It seems that the warden will go towards anything that makes sound. Whether it attacks them or not, we don't know.
this is awesome! I think in the video they said the warden attacks sound so I think this is already a feature but if it not this should definitely implement this

I think this would be really fun for farms especially if it gives a reason to lead the warden up to the surface. Also, with this aggresssion do you think the wardens could attack each other? Maybe they‚Äôll weaken each other greatly and make the fight easier!

@Alex Nice that sounds so epic, but if the sculk sensors wouldn‚Äôt react to ambient sounds (sounds and vibrations they hear all the time) the warden would logically not attack other wardens and recognise their sounds as ones from their own species.
Guess guess what! This has already been confirmed. Warden‚Äôs will attack all mobs that make sound except for other wardens. But I‚Äôll still vote for u. :)
not bunnies though,
Fun fact: bald eagles are better known as scavengers
What if this Stork could act similarly to an AFK fishing farm? They could grab loot from the water and you have to give them fish to trade
Like like your idea
It would be cool if they came in all the colours and glowed in their individual colours.
We could make with that neon ink some colorful neon glass that emits light, and some goggles that let us see in the dark and in water!
I think that would be super cool, except make the spawn less than moderate. There's already skeletons and ghasts that can kill you very quickly.
